name: Niccolò Meneghetti
content: Niccolò Meneghetti Niccolò Meneghetti Niccolò Meneghetti Research Teaching Students Code Patents Blog About Me I am an assistant professor in the Department of Computer and Information Science (CIS) at University of Michigan-Dearborn. I work in the area of Database Systems, with primary focus on probabilistic databases, statistical relational learning and uncertain data management. I am affiliated with the Dearborn Artificial Intelligence Research (DAIR) Center and the Michigan Institute for Data Science (MIDAS). I graduated from SUNY Buffalo, under the supervision of Prof. Jan Chomicki and Prof. Oliver Kennedy. Before joining UM-Dearborn, I used to work at Vertica. News! UM-Dearborn is now offering a Rackham PhD program in Computer Science. If you are interested in working with me, please email me your résumé, transcripts and published research papers. Contact information 242 Computer and Information Science Building 4901 Evergreen Road Dearborn, MI 48128, U.S.A. email: niccolom 'at' umich 'dot' edu
